LayoutNode.Content: NEWS Hawaii's Kilauea Volcano Destroys Hundreds of Homes, Including Big Island Mayor's House,Official Says Sean Breslin June 05 2018 12:00 AM EDT weather.com
LayoutNode.SRC:
News

Hawaii's Kilauea Volcano Destroys Hundreds of Homes, Including Big Island Mayor's House, Official Says

Sean Breslin

June 05 2018 12:00 AM EDT

weather.com

LayoutNode.Content: 00:39 Volcano Erupts as Island Recovers from Earthquake, Tsunami Nature is piling more devastation on an Indonesian island recovering from a deadly earthquake and tsunami.
LayoutNode.SRC:
00:39

Volcano Erupts as Island Recovers from Earthquake, Tsunami

Nature is piling more devastation on an Indonesian island recovering from a deadly earthquake and tsunami.

LayoutNode.Content: At a Glance ▪ An official told the Associated Press that hundreds more homes were destroyed overnight on the Big Island by Kilauea. ▪ Lava flows have covered at least 8 square miles in the Puna district. ▪ More than a dozen residents who ignored evacuation orders have been arrested in the past week.
LayoutNode.SRC:
At a Glance

▪ An official told the Associated Press that hundreds more homes were destroyed overnight on the Big Island by Kilauea.▪ Lava flows have covered at least 8 square miles in the Puna district.▪ More than a dozen residents who ignored evacuation orders have been arrested in the past week.

LayoutNode.Content: This article is no longer being updated. For the latest impacts, click here.
LayoutNode.SRC: This article is no longer being updated. For the latest impacts, click here.

LayoutNode.Content: As lava from the Kilauea Volcano continues to reportedly destroy hundreds of homes in the Lower Puna area of Hawaii, the Big Island's mayorreceived news on Tuesday that his own home was not spared.
LayoutNode.SRC: As lava from the Kilauea Volcano continues to reportedly destroy hundreds of homes in the Lower Puna area of Hawaii, the Big Island's mayor received news on Tuesday that his own home was not spared.

LayoutNode.Content: Star-Advertiser reported.
LayoutNode.SRC: Star-Advertiser reported.

LayoutNode.Content: "Harry had a premonition this was going to happen," Hawaii County Civil Defense spokeswoman Janet Snyder told the Star-Advertiser."Vacationland is almost totally destroyed."
LayoutNode.SRC: "Harry had a premonition this was going to happen," Hawaii County Civil Defense spokeswoman Janet Snyder told the Star-Advertiser. "Vacationland is almost totally destroyed."

LayoutNode.Content: (MORE: Blue Flames Shoot Out of Ground near Lava)
LayoutNode.SRC: (MORE: Blue Flames Shoot Out of Ground near Lava)

LayoutNode.Content: Snyder also said 117 homes have been lost since lava began flowing from fissures a month ago, but they expect that number to rise dramaticallywhen additional mapping of impacted areas is performed. Thousands have been forced to evacuate, and for some, it has been weeks since theywere forced out.
LayoutNode.SRC: Snyder also said 117 homes have been lost since lava began flowing from fissures a month ago, but they expect that number to rise dramatically when additional mapping of impacted areas is performed. Thousands have been forced to evacuate, and for some, it has been weeks since they were forced out.

LayoutNode.Content: The lava has now covered an 8-square-mile swath of land, scientists told the Associated Press. Lava destroyed hundreds of homes overnightMonday and into Tuesday morning, a Hawaii County official told the AP.
LayoutNode.SRC: The lava has now covered an 8-square-mile swath of land, scientists told the Associated Press. Lava destroyed hundreds of homes overnight Monday and into Tuesday morning, a Hawaii County official told the AP.

LayoutNode.Content: people out of an area where they'd become trapped by lava Sunday morning , Reuters reported. The lava continues to cut off roadways in the lower Puna area, threatening to strand anyone who stayed behind.
LayoutNode.SRC: people out of an area where they'd become trapped by lava Sunday morning, Reuters reported. The lava continues to cut off roadways in thelower Puna area, threatening to strand anyone who stayed behind.

LayoutNode.Content: Authorities told the AP that 18 arrests have been made in the past week due to residents loitering in a disaster area. Those who had to berescued were also cited for failing to leave a disaster area, the report added.
LayoutNode.SRC: Authorities told the AP that 18 arrests have been made in the past week due to residents loitering in a disaster area. Those who had to be rescued were also cited for failing to leave a disaster area, the report added.

LayoutNode.Content: "I can no longer afford to put residents at risk," Hawaii County Mayor Harry Kim said during a press conference. "I can no longer afford to putDOCARE, police, fire, National Guard to go banging in the dark of a neighborhood they don't know to say, 'You must get out now.'"
LayoutNode.SRC: "I can no longer afford to put residents at risk," Hawaii County Mayor Harry Kim said during a press conference. "I can no longer afford to put DOCARE, police, fire, National Guard to go banging in the dark of a neighborhood they don't know to say, 'You must get out now.'"

LayoutNode.Content: Those who were forced to evacuate joined hundreds of evacuees at nearby shelters, some of whom have been away from their homes for weeks.Some have been allowed to return to their homes to gather belongings as conditions allow, but they're aware that every trip home could be thelast time they see their houses.
LayoutNode.SRC: Those who were forced to evacuate joined hundreds of evacuees at nearby shelters, some of whom have been away from their homes for weeks. Some have been allowed to return to their homes to gather belongings as conditions allow, but they're aware that every trip home could be the last time they see their houses.

LayoutNode.Content: "We evacuated the first day. We didn’t think we’re ever coming back after that," Leilani Estates resident Lori Wada told the Honolulu Civil Beat.
LayoutNode.SRC: "We evacuated the first day. We didn’t think we’re ever coming back after that," Leilani Estates resident Lori Wada told the Honolulu Civil Beat.

LayoutNode.Content: Some of those who sought shelter at the Pahoa Community Center have slept in tents every day for weeks, the report added.
LayoutNode.SRC: Some of those who sought shelter at the Pahoa Community Center have slept in tents every day for weeks, the report added.

LayoutNode.Content: "I don’t want to talk about it," one man told the Civil Beat. "It’s too painful."
LayoutNode.SRC: "I don’t want to talk about it," one man told the Civil Beat. "It’s too painful."

LayoutNode.Content: (PHOTOS: Kilauea's Month-Long Eruption)
LayoutNode.SRC: (PHOTOS: Kilauea's Month-Long Eruption)

LayoutNode.Content: Over the weekend, a 400-year-old lake vanished within hours after lava entered it and boiled away all of its water.
LayoutNode.SRC: Over the weekend, a 400-year-old lake vanished within hours after lava entered it and boiled away all of its water.

LayoutNode.Content: USGS reported. It seeped into the lake between roughly 11:30 a.m. and 1:30 p.m., and had completely evaporated all of its water by 3 p.m.
LayoutNode.SRC: USGS reported. It seeped into the lake between roughly 11:30 a.m. and 1:30 p.m., and had completely evaporated all of its water by 3 p.m.

LayoutNode.Content: It's the larger of the island's two freshwater lakes.
LayoutNode.SRC: It's the larger of the island's two freshwater lakes.

LayoutNode.Content: (MORE: Kalapana, Hawaii Burning: The History of Kilauea's Catastrophic Lava Flow)
LayoutNode.SRC: (MORE: Kalapana, Hawaii Burning: The History of Kilauea's Catastrophic Lava Flow)

LayoutNode.Content: Island. Island officials warned residents and visitors to take precautions, as some could experience respiratory problems.
LayoutNode.SRC: Island. Island officials warned residents and visitors to take precautions, as some could experience respiratory problems.

LayoutNode.Content: that a man sustained a "serious" injury on his leg two weeks ago when he was "lava-bombed" by splatter that hit him while he was sitting on the porch of a home near the Lanipuna Garden subdivision.
LayoutNode.SRC: that a man sustained a "serious" injury on his leg two weeks ago when he was "lava-bombed" by splatter that hit him while he was sitting on theporch of a home near the Lanipuna Garden subdivision.

LayoutNode.Content: The incident reportedly shattered the victim's leg from his shin to his foot and he was taken to a hospital to be treated, ABC News reported.
LayoutNode.SRC: The incident reportedly shattered the victim's leg from his shin to his foot and he was taken to a hospital to be treated, ABC News reported.

LayoutNode.SRC: 

LayoutNode.Content: 1 of 811 This image taken from video on Monday, June 4, 2018, and provided by the U.S. Geological Survey shows lava from a fissure flowing into the ocean at Kapoho Bay at Kapoho on the island of Hawaii. Afteroverrunning the town overnight and destroying hundreds of homes, the lava flowed into the shallow bay and had nearly filled it. (U.S. Geological Survey via AP)
LayoutNode.SRC:
1 of 811
This image taken from video on Monday, June 4, 2018, and provided by the U.S. Geological Survey shows lava from a fissure flowing into the ocean at Kapoho Bay at Kapoho on the island of Hawaii. After overrunning the town overnight and destroying hundreds of homes, the lava flowed into the shallow bay and had nearly filled it. (U.S. Geological Survey via AP)
